result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Allen Scholtz

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty William Reabe appointed as dean atty for Deft - repayment of $150 per mth comm 1-1-2023

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Letter from JA to Deft re: dean atty

9:54 AM Defendant Anthony Allen Scholtz in court.  Attorney Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF244, 22TR1312 - 1315.
Court inquires on atty.
Deft heard - went to the PD office to see if he qualifies.
Does not qualify for PD.
ADA heard on Deft's new case.
Deft heard.
Atty Reabe is present and is heard - will take the case.
DA provides a copy of the complaint.
Atty Reabe heard.
Requests prelim.
Court schedules.
Court reviews Dean process with Deft.
Deft to complete Dean paperwork, if he does not qualify for Public Defender.
Atty Reabe to represent either way.
If appointment will be by Dean, Deft to repay at $150 per month beginning 01-01-2023.
9:59 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:46 AM Defendant Anthony Allen Scholtz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF244, and 22TR1312 - 1315.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
Court inquires on Atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $3,000 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today w/o a valid Rx, may not go into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, or restaurants that serve alcohol. 
Deft to contact the Public Defender's office today.
Court schedules with parties.
9:52 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
